info.title: BatchService
info.description: A client for issuing REST requests to the Azure Batch service.

get.description: Lists all of the applications available in the specified account.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The maximum time that the server can spend processing the request, in seconds. The default is 30 seconds.

parameters.name: client-request-id
parameters.description: The caller-generated request identity, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such as curly braces, e.g. 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0.

parameters.name: return-client-request-id
parameters.description: Whether the server should return the client-request-id identifier in the response.

parameters.name: ocp-date
parameters.description: The time the request was issued. If not specified, this header will be automatically populated with the current system clock time.

client-request-id.description: The ClientRequestId provided by the client during the request, if present and requested to be returned.

request-id.description: The value that uniquely identifies a request.

ETag.description: The content of the ETag HTTP response header.

Last-Modified.description: The content of the Last-Modified HTTP response header.

default.description: The error from the Batch service.

get.description: Lists the usage metrics, aggregated by pool across individual time intervals, for the specified account.

parameters.name: starttime
parameters.description: The earliest time from which to include metrics. This must be at least two and a half hours before the current time.

parameters.name: endtime
parameters.description: The latest time from which to include metrics. This must be at least two hours before the current time.

delete.description: Deletes the specified task file from the compute node where the task ran.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job that contains the task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The id of the task whose file you want to delete.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The path to the task file that you want to delete.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Whether to delete children of a directory. If the fileName parameter represents a directory instead of a file, you can set Recursive to true to delete the directory and all of the files and subdirectories in it. If Recursive is false then the directory must be empty or deletion will fail.

poolId.description: The id of the pool whose metrics are being aggregated.

startTime.description: The start time of the aggregation interval.

endTime.description: The end time of the aggregation interval.

vmSize.description: The size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.

totalCoreHours.description: The total core hours used in the pool during this aggregation interval.

dataIngressGiB.description: The cross data center network ingress in GiB to the pool during this interval.

dataEgressGiB.description: The cross data center network egress in GiB from the pool during this interval.

PoolUsageMetrics.description: Usage metrics for a pool across an aggregation interval.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

verifiedImageReferences.description: The list of images verified to be compatible with this node agent SKU. This collection is not exhaustive (the node agent may be compatible with other images).

osType.description: The type of operating system compatible with the node agent SKU.

NodeAgentSku.description: A node agent SKU supported by the Batch service. The Batch node agent is a program that runs on each node in the pool, and provides the command-and-control interface between the node and the Batch service. There are different implementations of the node agent, known as SKUs, for different operating systems.

value.description: The list of supported node agent SKUs.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

dedicatedCoreTime.description: The aggregated wall-clock time of the dedicated compute node cores being part of the pool.

UsageStatistics.description: Statistics related to pool usage information.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

avgCPUPercentage.description: The average CPU usage across all nodes in the pool (percentage per node).

avgMemoryGiB.description: The average memory usage in GiB across all nodes in the pool.

peakMemoryGiB.description: The peak memory usage in GiB across all nodes in the pool.

avgDiskGiB.description: The average used disk space in GiB across all nodes in the pool.

peakDiskGiB.description: The peak used disk space in GiB across all nodes in the pool.

diskReadIOps.description: The total number of disk read operations across all nodes in the pool.

diskWriteIOps.description: The total number of disk write operations across all nodes in the pool.

diskReadGiB.description: The total amount of data in GiB of disk reads across all nodes in the pool.

diskWriteGiB.description: The total amount of data in GiB of disk writes across all nodes in the pool.

networkReadGiB.description: The total amount of data in GiB of network reads across all nodes in the pool.

networkWriteGiB.description: The total amount of data in GiB of network writes across all nodes in the pool.

ResourceStatistics.description: Statistics related to resource consumption by compute nodes in a pool.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

usageStats.description: Statistics related to pool usage, such as the amount of core-time used.

resourceStats.description: Statistics related to resource consumption by compute nodes in the pool.

PoolStatistics.description: Contains utilization and resource usage statistics for the lifetime of a pool.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

userCPUTime.description: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all tasks in the job.

kernelCPUTime.description: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all tasks in the job.

wallClockTime.description: The total wall clock time of all tasks in the job.

readIOps.description: The total number of disk read operations made by all tasks in the job.

writeIOps.description: The total number of disk write operations made by all tasks in the job.

readIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes read from disk by all tasks in the job.

writeIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes written to disk by all tasks in the job.

numSucceededTasks.description: The total number of tasks successfully completed in the job during the given time range.

numFailedTasks.description: The total number of tasks in the job that failed during the given time range.

numTaskRetries.description: The total number of retries on all the tasks in the job during the given time range.

waitTime.description: The total wait time of all tasks in the job. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)

JobStatistics.description: Resource usage statistics for a job.

name.description: The name in the name-value pair.

value.description: The value in the name-value pair.

code.description: An identifier for the certificate deletion error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the certificate deletion error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

values.description: A list of additional error details related to the certificate deletion error.

DeleteCertificateError.description: An error encountered by the Batch service when deleting a certificate.

thumbprint.description: The X.509 thumbprint of the certificate. This is a sequence of up to 40 hex digits (it may include spaces but these are removed).

thumbprintAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to derive the thumbprint. This must be sha1.

state.description: The current state of the certificate.

stateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the certificate entered its current state.

previousState.description: The previous state of the certificate. This property is not set if the certificate is in its initial Active state.

previousStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the certificate entered its previous state. This property is not set if the certificate is in its initial Active state.

publicData.description: The public part of the certificate as a base-64 encoded .cer file.

deleteCertificateError.description: The error that occurred on the last attempt to delete this certificate. This property is set only if the certificate is in the deletefailed state.

Certificate.description: A certificate that can be installed on compute nodes and can be used to authenticate operations on the machine.

applicationId.description: The id of the application to install.

version.description: The version of the application to install. If omitted, the default version is installed.

ApplicationPackageReference.description: A reference to an application package to be installed on compute nodes in a pool.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the application within the account.

displayName.description: The display name for the application.

ApplicationSummary.description: Contains information about an application in an Azure Batch account.

thumbprint.description: The X.509 thumbprint of the certificate. This is a sequence of up to 40 hex digits (it may include spaces but these are removed).

thumbprintAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to derive the thumbprint. This must be sha1.

data.description: The base64-encoded contents of the certificate. The maximum size is 10KB.

certificateFormat.description: The format of the certificate data.

password.description: The password to access the certificate's private key.

CertificateAddParameter.description: A certificate that can be installed on compute nodes and can be used to authenticate operations on the machine.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

lastModified.description: The time at which the file was last modified.

contentType.description: The content type of the file.

fileMode.description: The file mode attribute in octal format. This property will be returned only from a Linux compute node.

FileProperties.description: The properties of a file on a compute node.

isDirectory.description: Whether the object represents a directory.

NodeFile.description: Information about a file or directory on a compute node.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

NodeFileListResult.description: Response to a FileOperation.ListFromComputeNode or FileOperation.ListFromTask request.

doNotRunUntil.description: The earliest time at which any job may be created under this job schedule. If you do not specify a doNotRunUntil time, the schedule becomes ready to create jobs immediately.

doNotRunAfter.description: A time after which no job will be created under this job schedule. The schedule will move to the completed state as soon as this deadline is past and there is no active job under this job schedule.

startWindow.description: The time interval, starting from the time at which the schedule indicates a job should be created, within which a job must be created. If a job is not created within the startWindow interval, then the 'opportunity' is lost; no job will be created until the next recurrence of the schedule.

recurrenceInterval.description: The time interval between the start times of two successive jobs under the job schedule. A job schedule can have at most one active job under it at any given time.

Schedule.description: The schedule according to which jobs will be created

maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job starts. If the job does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it and any tasks that are still running.

maxTaskRetryCount.description: The maximum number of times each task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

JobConstraints.description: Specifies the execution constraints for jobs created on a schedule.

blobSource.description: The URL of the file within Azure Blob Storage. This URL should include a shared access signature if the blob is not publicly readable.

filePath.description: The location to which to download the file, relative to the task's working directory.

fileMode.description: The file mode attribute in octal format. This property will be ignored if it is specified for a resourceFile which will be downloaded to a Windows compute node.

ResourceFile.description: A file to be downloaded from Azure blob storage to a compute node.

name.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

EnvironmentSetting.description: An environment variable to be set on a task process.

maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

retentionTime.description: The minimum time to retain the working directory for the task on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents. The default is infinite.

maxTaskRetryCount.description: The maximum number of times the task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

TaskConstraints.description: Constraints to apply to the Job Manager task.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Manager task. A GUID is recommended.

displayName.description: The display name of the Job Manager task.

commandLine.description: The command line of the Job Manager task.

resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Manager task.

constraints.description: Constraints that apply to the Job Manager task.

killJobOnCompletion.description: Whether completion of the Job Manager task signifies completion of the entire job.

runElevated.description: Whether to run the Job Manager task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

runExclusive.description: Whether the Job Manager task requires exclusive use of the compute node where it runs. If true, no other tasks will run on the same compute node for as long as the Job Manager is running. If false, other tasks can run simultaneously with the Job Manager on a compute node. (The Job Manager task counts normally against the nodes concurrent task limit, so this is only relevant if the node allows multiple concurrent tasks.)

JobManagerTask.description: Specifies details of a Job Manager task.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the job preparation task within the job. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

commandLine.description: The command line of the Job Preparation task.

resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Preparation task.

constraints.description: Constraints that apply to the Job Preparation task.

waitForSuccess.description: Whether the Batch service should wait for the Job Preparation task to complete successfully before scheduling any other tasks of the job on the compute node.

runElevated.description: Whether to run the Job Preparation task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

rerunOnNodeRebootAfterSuccess.description: Whether the Batch service should rerun the Job Preparation task after a compute node reboots. Note that the Job Preparation task should still be written to be idempotent because it can be rerun if the compute node is rebooted while Job Preparation task is still running. The default value is true.

JobPreparationTask.description: A Job Preparation task to run before any tasks of the job on any given compute node.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Release task within the job. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

commandLine.description: The command line of the Job Release task.

resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Release task.

maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the Job Release task may run on a given compute node, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it. The default value is 15 minutes.

retentionTime.description: The minimum time to retain the working directory for the Job Release task on the compute node. After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents. The default is infinite.

runElevated.description: Whether to run the Job Release task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

JobReleaseTask.description: A Job Release task to run on job completion on any compute node where the job has run.

nodeFillType.description: How tasks should be distributed across compute nodes

TaskSchedulingPolicy.description: Specifies how tasks should be distributed across compute nodes.

commandLine.description: The command line of the start task.

resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the start task.

runElevated.description: Whether to run the start task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

maxTaskRetryCount.description: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.

waitForSuccess.description: Whether the Batch service should wait for the start task to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.

StartTask.description: A task which is run when a compute node joins a pool in the Azure Batch service, or when the compute node is rebooted or reimaged.

thumbprintAlgorithm.description: The algorithm with which the thumbprint is associated. This must be sha1.

storeLocation.description: The location of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate. The default value is CurrentUser.

storeName.description: The name of the certificate store on the compute node into which to install the certificate. The default value is My.

visibility.description: Which user accounts on the compute node should have access to the private data of the certificate. This may be any subset of the values 'starttask', 'task' and 'remoteuser', separated by commas. The default is all accounts, corresponding to the string 'starttask,task,remoteuser'.

CertificateReference.description: A reference to a certificate to be installed on compute nodes in a pool.

name.description: The name of the metadata item.

value.description: The value of the metadata item.

MetadataItem.description: A name-value pair associated with a Batch service resource. The Batch service does not assign any meaning to this metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

displayName.description: The display name for the pool.

vmSize.description: The size of the virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

cloudServiceConfiguration.description: The cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

virtualMachineConfiguration.description: The virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

maxTasksPerNode.description: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

taskSchedulingPolicy.description: How tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

resizeTimeout.description: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

targetDedicated.description: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

enableAutoScale.description: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.

autoScaleFormula.description: The formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

autoScaleEvaluationInterval.description: A time interval for the desired AutoScale evaluation period in the pool.

enableInterNodeCommunication.description: Whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

startTask.description: A task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

certificateReferences.description: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

applicationPackageReferences.description: The list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

PoolSpecification.description: Specification for creating a new pool.

autoPoolIdPrefix.description: A prefix to be added to the unique identifier when a pool is automatically created. The prefix can be up to 20 characters long.

poolLifetimeOption.description: The minimum lifetime of created auto pools, and how multiple jobs on a schedule are assigned to pools.

keepAlive.description: Whether to keep an auto pool alive after its lifetime expires.

pool.description: The pool specification for the auto pool.

AutoPoolSpecification.description: Specifies characteristics for a temporary 'auto pool'. The Batch service will create this auto pool, run all the tasks for the job on it, and will delete the pool once the job has completed.

poolId.description: The id of an existing pool. All the tasks of the job will run on the specified pool. You must specify either PoolId or AutoPoolSpecification, but not both.

autoPoolSpecification.description: Characteristics for a temporary 'auto pool'. The Batch service will create this auto pool and run all of the tasks of the job on it, and will delete the pool once the job has completed. You must specify either PoolId or AutoPoolSpecification, but not both.

PoolInformation.description: Specifies how a job should be assigned to a pool.

priority.description: The priority of jobs created under this schedule. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. The default value is 0.

displayName.description: The display name for jobs created under this schedule. It need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

usesTaskDependencies.description: The flag that determines if this job will use tasks with dependencies.

constraints.description: The execution constraints for jobs created under this schedule.

jobManagerTask.description: The details of a Job Manager task to be launched when a job is started under this schedule.

jobPreparationTask.description: The Job Preparation task for jobs created under this schedule.

jobReleaseTask.description: The Job Release task for jobs created under this schedule.

commonEnvironmentSettings.description: A list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in jobs created under this schedule (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

poolInfo.description: The pool on which the Batch service runs the tasks of jobs created under this schedule.

metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with each job created under this schedule as metadata.

JobSpecification.description: Specifies details of the jobs to be created on a schedule.

RecentJob.description: Information about the most recent job to run under the job schedule.

nextRunTime.description: The next time at which a job will be created under this schedule.

recentJob.description: Information about the most recent job under the job schedule.

endTime.description: The time at which the schedule ended. This property is set only if the job schedule is in the completed state.

JobScheduleExecutionInformation.description: Specifies how tasks should be run in a job associated with a job schedule.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

userCPUTime.description: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

kernelCPUTime.description: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

wallClockTime.description: The total wall clock time of all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

readIOps.description: The total number of disk read operations made by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

writeIOps.description: The total number of disk write operations made by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

readIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes read from disk by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

writeIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes written to disk by all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

numSucceededTasks.description: The total number of tasks successfully completed during the given time range in jobs created under the schedule. A task completes successfully if it returns exit code 0.

numFailedTasks.description: The total number of tasks that failed during the given time range in jobs created under the schedule. A task fails if it exhausts its maximum retry count without returning exit code 0.

numTaskRetries.description: The total number of retries during the given time range on all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule.

waitTime.description: The total wait time of all tasks in all jobs created under the schedule. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)

JobScheduleStatistics.description: Resource usage statistics for a job schedule.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the schedule within the account. A GUID is recommended.

displayName.description: The display name for the schedule.

url.description: The URL of the job schedule.

eTag.description: The ETag of the job schedule.

lastModified.description: The last modified time of the job schedule.

previousState.description: The previous state of the job schedule.

previousStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the job schedule entered its previous state.

schedule.description: The schedule according to which jobs will be created.

jobSpecification.description: The details of the jobs to be created on this schedule.

executionInfo.description: Information about jobs that have been and will be run under this schedule.

metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the schedule as metadata.

stats.description: The lifetime resource usage statistics for the job schedule.

CloudJobSchedule.description: A job schedule that allows recurring jobs by specifying when to run jobs and a specification used to create each job.

CloudJobListResult.description: Response to a CloudJobOperation.List or ListFromJobSchedule request.

category.description: The category of the task scheduling error.

code.description: An identifier for the task scheduling error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the task scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

details.description: The list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

TaskSchedulingError.description: Information about an error when scheduling a task.

startTime.description: The time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted, this value is updated.

endTime.description: The time at which the Job Preparation task completed. This property is set only if the task is in the Completed state.

state.description: The current state of the Job Preparation task.

taskRootDirectory.description: The root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task, such as log files.

taskRootDirectoryUrl.description: The URL to the root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node.

exitCode.description: The exit code of the Job Preparation task. This property is set only if the task is in the Completed state.

schedulingError.description: The error encountered by the Batch service when starting the task.

retryCount.description: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed a task failure. The Batch service will retry the task up to the limit specified by the constraints.

lastRetryTime.description: The most recent time at which a retry of the Job Preparation task started running. This property is set only if the task was retried (i.e. retryCount is nonzero).

JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.description: Contains information about the execution of a Job Preparation task on a compute node.

startTime.description: The time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted, this value is updated.

endTime.description: The time at which the Job Release task completed. This property is set only if the task is in the Completed state.

state.description: The current state of the Job Release task.

taskRootDirectory.description: The root directory of the Job Release task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task, such as log files.

taskRootDirectoryUrl.description: The URL to the root directory of the Job Release task on the compute node.

exitCode.description: The exit code of the Job Release task. This property is set only if the task is in the Completed state.

schedulingError.description: The scheduling error encountered by the Batch service when starting the task.

JobReleaseTaskExecutionInformation.description: Contains information about the execution of a Job Release task on a compute node.

poolId.description: The id of the pool containing the compute node to which this entry refers.

nodeId.description: The id of the compute node to which this entry refers.

nodeUrl.description: The URL of the compute node to which this entry refers.

jobPreparationTaskExecutionInfo.description: Information about the execution status of the Job Preparation task on this compute node.

jobReleaseTaskExecutionInfo.description: Information about the execution status of the Job Release task on this compute node. This property is set only if the Job Release task has run on the node.

JobPreparationAndReleaseTaskExecutionInf.description: The status of the Job Preparation and Job Release tasks on a compute node.

value.description: A list of Job Preparation and Job Release task execution information.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

code.description: An identifier for the autoscale error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the autoscale error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

values.description: A list of additional error details related to the autoscale error.

AutoScaleRunError.description: An error that occurred when executing or evaluating a pool autoscale formula.

timestamp.description: The time at which the autoscale formula was last evaluated.

results.description: The final values of all variables used in the evaluation of the autoscale formula. Each variable value is returned in the form $variable=value, and variables are separated by semicolons.

error.description: Details of the error encountered evaluating the autoscale formula on the pool, if the evaluation was unsuccessful.

AutoScaleRun.description: The results and errors from an execution of a pool autoscale formula.

code.description: An identifier for the pool resize error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the pool resize error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

values.description: A list of additional error details related to the pool resize error.

ResizeError.description: An error that occurred when resizing a pool.

osFamily.description: The Azure Guest OS family to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.

targetOSVersion.description: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool. The default value is * which specifies the latest operating system version for the specified OS family.

currentOSVersion.description: The Azure Guest OS Version currently installed on the virtual machines in the pool. This may differ from TargetOSVersion if the pool state is Upgrading.

CloudServiceConfiguration.description: The configuration for nodes in a pool based on the Azure Cloud Services platform.

publisher.description: The publisher of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image. For example, Canonical or MicrosoftWindowsServer.

offer.description: The offer type of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image. For example, UbuntuServer or WindowsServer.

sku.description: The SKU of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image. For example, 14.04.0-LTS or 2012-R2-Datacenter.

version.description: The version of the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image. A value of 'latest' can be specified to select the latest version of an image. If omitted, the default is 'latest'.

ImageReference.description: A reference to an Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image.

enableAutomaticUpdates.description: Whether automatic updates are enabled on the virtual machine. If omitted, the default value is true.

WindowsConfiguration.description: Windows operating system settings to apply to the virtual machine.

imageReference.description: A reference to the Azure Virtual Machines Marketplace image to use.

nodeAgentSKUId.description: The SKU of Batch Node Agent to be provisioned on the compute node. The Batch node agent is a program that runs on each node in the pool, and provides the command-and-control interface between the node and the Batch service. There are different implementations of the node agent, known as SKUs, for different operating systems.

windowsConfiguration.description: Windows operating system settings on the virtual machine. This property must not be specified if the ImageReference property specifies a Linux OS image.

VirtualMachineConfiguration.description: The configuration for compute nodes in a pool based on the Azure Virtual Machines infrastructure.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the pool within the account. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

displayName.description: The display name for the pool.

lastModified.description: The last modified time of the pool.

creationTime.description: The creation time of the pool.

state.description: The current state of the pool.

stateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the pool entered its current state.

allocationStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.

vmSize.description: The size of virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

cloudServiceConfiguration.description: The cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

virtualMachineConfiguration.description: The virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

resizeTimeout.description: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool. In a Get Pool operation, this is the timeout for the most recent resize operation. The default value is 10 minutes.

resizeError.description: Details of any error encountered while performing the last resize on the pool. This property is set only if an error occurred during the last pool resize, and only when the pool AllocationState is Steady.

currentDedicated.description: The number of compute nodes currently in the pool.

targetDedicated.description: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool. This property must have the default value if EnableAutoScale is true. It is required if EnableAutoScale is false.

enableAutoScale.description: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time. If true, the AutoScaleFormula property must be set. If false, the TargetDedicated property must be set.

autoScaleFormula.description: A formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

autoScaleEvaluationInterval.description: A time interval for the desired AutoScale evaluation period in the pool.

autoScaleRun.description: The results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.

enableInterNodeCommunication.description: Whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

startTask.description: A task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.

certificateReferences.description: The list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

applicationPackageReferences.description: The list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

maxTasksPerNode.description: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

taskSchedulingPolicy.description: How the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.

metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

stats.description: Utilization and resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the pool.

CloudPool.description: A pool in the Azure Batch service.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the pool within the account. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

displayName.description: The display name for the pool.

vmSize.description: The size of virtual machines in the pool. All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.

cloudServiceConfiguration.description: The cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

virtualMachineConfiguration.description: The virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

resizeTimeout.description: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool. In a Get Pool operation, this is the timeout for the most recent resize operation. The default value is 10 minutes.

targetDedicated.description: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool. This property must have the default value if EnableAutoScale is true. It is required if EnableAutoScale is false.

enableAutoScale.description: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time. If true, the AutoScaleFormula property must be set. If false, the TargetDedicated property must be set.

autoScaleFormula.description: A formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

autoScaleEvaluationInterval.description: A time interval for the desired autoscale evaluation period in the pool.

enableInterNodeCommunication.description: Whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

startTask.description: A task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.

certificateReferences.description: The list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

applicationPackageReferences.description: The list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

maxTasksPerNode.description: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

taskSchedulingPolicy.description: How the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.

metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

PoolAddParameter.description: A pool in the Azure Batch service to add.

value.description: The list of applications available in the account.

odata.nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.
The URL to get the next set of results.

affinityId.description: An opaque string representing the location of a compute node or a task that has run previously. You can pass the AffinityId of a compute node or task to indicate that this task needs to be placed close to the node or task.

AffinityInformation.description: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start a task.

startTime.description: The time at which the task started running. If the task has been restarted or retried, this is the most recent time at which the task started running.

endTime.description: The time at which the task completed. This property is set only if the task is in the Completed state.

exitCode.description: The exit code of the task. This property is set only if the task is in completed state.

schedulingError.description: Details of any error encountered scheduling the task.

retryCount.description: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service.

lastRetryTime.description: The most recent time at which a retry of the task started running.

requeueCount.description: The number of times the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

lastRequeueTime.description: The most recent time at which the task has been requeued by the Batch service as the result of a user request.

TaskExecutionInformation.description: Information about the execution of a task.

affinityId.description: An identifier for the compute node on which the task ran, which can be passed when adding a task to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.

nodeUrl.description: The URL of the node on which the task ran.

poolId.description: The id of the pool on which the task ran.

nodeId.description: The id of the node on which the task ran.

taskRootDirectory.description: The root directory of the task on the compute node.

taskRootDirectoryUrl.description: The URL to the root directory of the task on the compute node.

ComputeNodeInformation.description: Information about the compute node on which a task ran.

numberOfInstances.description: The number of compute nodes required by the multi-instance task.

coordinationCommandLine.description: The command to run on the compute node instances for coordinating among the subtasks.

commonResourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download before running the coordination command line. The difference between common resource files and task resource files is that common resource files are downloaded for all subtasks including the primary, whereas task resource files are downloaded only for the primary.

MultiInstanceSettings.description: Settings which specify how to run a multi-instance task. Multi-instance tasks are commonly used to support MPI tasks.

startTime.description: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

lastUpdateTime.description: The time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

userCPUTime.description: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.

kernelCPUTime.description: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by the task.

wallClockTime.description: The total wall clock time of the task.

readIOps.description: The total number of disk read operations made by the task.

writeIOps.description: The total number of disk write operations made by the task.

readIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes read from disk by the task.

writeIOGiB.description: The total gibibytes written to disk by the task.

waitTime.description: The total wait time of the task. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task and the start of task execution. (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the most recent task execution.)

TaskStatistics.description: Resource usage statistics for a task.

taskIds.description: The list of task ids that must complete before this task can be scheduled.

taskIdRanges.description: The list of task ranges that must complete before this task can be scheduled.

TaskDependencies.description: Specifies any dependencies of a task. Any task that is explicitly specified or within a dependency range must complete before the dependant task will be scheduled.

start.description: The first task id in the range.

end.description: The last task id in the range.

TaskIdRange.description: A range of task ids that a task can depend on. All tasks with ids in the range must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the task within the job. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

displayName.description: A display name for the task.

lastModified.description: The last modified time of the task.

creationTime.description: The creation time of the task.

state.description: The current state of the task.

stateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the task entered its current state.

previousState.description: The previous state of the task. This property is not set if the task is in its initial Active state.

previousStateTransitionTime.description: The time at which the task entered its previous state. This property is not set if the task is in its initial Active state.

commandLine.description: The command line of the task. For multi-instance tasks, the command line is executed on the primary subtask after all the subtasks have finished executing the coordianation command line.

resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line. For multi-instance tasks, the resource files will only be downloaded to the compute node on which the primary subtask is executed.

environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the task.

affinityInfo.description: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start the new task.

constraints.description: The execution constraints that apply to this task.

runElevated.description: Whether to run the task in elevated mode.

executionInfo.description: Information about the execution of the task.

nodeInfo.description: Information about the compute node on which the task ran.

multiInstanceSettings.description: Information about how to run the multi-instance task.

message.description: A message describing the compute node error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

url.description: The URL of the compute node.

allocationTime.description: The time at which this compute node was allocated to the pool.

ipAddress.description: The IP address that other compute nodes can use to communicate with this compute node.

affinityId.description: An identifier which can be passed in the Add Task API to request that the task be scheduled close to this compute node.

vmSize.description: The size of the virtual machine hosting the compute node.

runningTasksCount.description: The total number of currently running job tasks on the compute node. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

totalTasksSucceeded.description: The total number of job tasks which completed successfully (with exitCode 0) on the compute node. This includes Job Preparation, Job Release, and Job Manager tasks, but not the pool start task.

recentTasks.description: The list of tasks that are currently running on the compute node.

disableTasks.description: What to do with active tasks associated with the job.

terminateReason.description: The text you want to appear as the job's TerminateReason. The default is 'UserTerminate'.

priority.description: The priority of the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. If omitted, the priority of the job is left unchanged.

constraints.description: The execution constraints for the job. If omitted, the existing execution constraints are left unchanged.

nodeDeallocationOption.description: When nodes may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing.
